result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Joseph C Miller was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $960.00 BAIL APPLIED. Remaining bail to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 9/01/2015. Alternate 40 days jail. Payment plan fee added of $15.00 and bail applied to that.
BAIL APPLIED. Blood draw costs PAID IN FULL. To be forwarded to the Village of Summit Police Dept.

FORTHWITH.
With Huber and standard release conditions.
Credit for 1 day.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Attendance to the Victim Impact Panel Meeting on 8/19/2015 or 20 days alternate consecutive.

To be completed within 1 year.
A review hearing will be set for 7/15/2016 at 9AM.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Joseph C Miller in court with attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. Ct. 3 dismissed by operation of law. Court will set a review hearing in one year. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1 :
-  300 days jail with Huber to commence FORTHWITH. Credit for One day. Huber with standard release conditions. 
-    36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
-    36 months Ignition Interlock every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting on August 19, 2015 or 20 days jail with Huber consecutive.
- Alcohol Assessment 
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $25.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Summit Police Department -  append to fine. 
- Fine totaling: $3014.00 to be paid at rate of $50.00 per month commencing September 1, 2015; alternate 40 days jail - APPLY BAIL
- Court orders community service in the mount of 100 hours within one year - Court will set a review hearing in one year
- Defendant was remanded to the custody of the Sheriff to commence the sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joseph C Miller in court with attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Fischer requests the matter to be set for plea and sentencing and allow time for treatment to complete.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Hearing on June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Joseph C Miller in court with attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a new date in 30 to 45 days. Court grants request. Defense to let court know on the next date if this matter will be set for a plea or trial.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
filed by Attorney Fischer.
Hearing on May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph C Miller in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.   Court advises of right to an attorney.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Bail remains as fixed.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  
  Hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.`

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Joseph C Miller in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant did not want to speak with the pubic defender. Defendant allowed a non-collect call.  Arraignment scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
